summary.simple: John Doe is leaving the hospital today. He has high blood sugar and high blood pressure. He needs to take his pills and follow the doctor's rules to stay well.
summary.standard: This document is about John Doe's discharge from the hospital. He has diabetes and high blood pressure. He needs to take some medications and follow certain instructions to stay healthy.
summary.detailed: Patient John Doe is being discharged following management of Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus and Hypertension. The discharge plan requires adherence to a multi-medication regimen and specific lifestyle modifications to maintain metabolic stability and cardiovascular health.

diagnoses.name: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.plain_language: This means the body has trouble using sugar for energy, which can lead to high blood sugar.

diagnoses.name: Hypertension
diagnoses.plain_language: This means high blood pressure, which can cause health problems if not treated.

action_items: Monitor blood glucose levels daily before breakfast
Follow up with Dr. Williams in 2 weeks
Return to ER if experiencing chest pain, severe headache, or blood glucose over 400mg/dL
warnings: Return to ER if experiencing chest pain, severe headache, or blood glucose >400mg/dL
